Topic: Medicine

Question: Narrowest pa of uterine tube is: March 2013
Choices:
  A: Infundibulum
  B: Ampulla
  C: Isthmus
  D: Interstitial
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
Instructions:
1. Identify the four parts of the uterine tube.
2. Understand the anatomy and function of each part.
3. Identify the narrowest part of the uterine tube.
4. Double-check your answer with the anatomy of the female reproductive system.
5. Choose the answer that matches your identified part.

Thought:
The four parts of the uterine tube are the infundibulum, ampulla, isthmus, and interstitial.
The infundibulum is the funnel-shaped opening of the uterine tube that captures the egg released from the ovary.
The ampulla is the widest and longest part of the uterine tube where fertilization usually occurs.
The isthmus is the narrowest and shortest part of the uterine tube that connects the ampulla to the uterus.
The interstitial part is the portion of the uterine tube that is embedded in the wall of the uterus.
The narrowest part of the uterine tube is the isthmus.
Action: Answer("C")
